titleStmt.title: Stephen Dunn et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG5566

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
To His Excellency
Tho E Bramlett
Govenor of Kentucky

Your petitioners citizens of Grayson County respectfully represent that at the present November Term of the Grayson Circuit Court Jno Sapp was convicted of Grand Larceny and sentenced to serve one year in the Penatentiary, That said Sapp is so nearly an imbecile as in our opinion to be incapable of committing crime- He is incapable of comprehending the moral law & of understanding that it was against conscience to steal- He has had the misfortune to lose one arm in the United States service in the late war and is thus disabled from labor & will thus be rendered of no service to the state- The great object of punishment will be in no degree advanced by his confinement in prison and it can serve no other purpose than to inflict suffering on him for a crime he did not comprehend, We humbly recommend him to your most favorable
consideration

Stephen Dunn
Alex kerr
C. C. Bacon
Jas W. Moorse
James Cravins
John George Cravins
W B Cook
Jones Morris
Miles T jennett
Wm Galloway
Wm Galloway Jr
Caleb Miller
Wade J Miller
M R J Mercer
A. E. Ward
Alexander S King
Marshall Morris
Wm Elder

Grayson Cir Ct
vs
Jno. Sapp
Penitentiary
